Posts.Content: Hi DJC Like you and Roxanne, my hair also came back a different color of gray, white and black look. But now it appears to be turning brown, so I have no clue what its doing..lol My treatment ended September and its very cury and I have had two haicuts. I figured I would wait until April to see what it was going to turn into since it seems to be turning light brown now. I was going to get it highlighted but now you bring up some good points. Also, I did not want to dye it because I have never dyed my hair and I don't want to become a slave to keeping up roots. I wonder why it comes back such a different color, especially since I never had gray hair before. To tell you the truth I am getting kind of use to it and I am really excited about having hair, and curly too!!!lol. Lets see what others say about coloring the hair.. Kris

Posts.Title: Dental problems after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all, As a continuation of the thread for MRI's, I thought I would post an article that I found. Maybe some of you have already read it. Since we all already had breast cancer, I think we are all in the high risk now. I have had my first MRI because the mammogram or ultrasound could not rule out cancer in my other breat. If you haven't already talked with your doctor about MRI, you may want to look into it. Both are valuable at reading different kinds of cancer that one or the other may not pick up. As in my case and many others here the mammogram did not pick up my cancer. Kris http://www.cancerpage.com/news/article.asp?id=7318
